definitions.body: (= pl. majest. Nö:ZMG xlii (1888), 476) a king of idol, obj. of reverence, and means of divination (√ and etymol.-mng. dub., cf. GFM:Hast. DB TERAPHIM Say:ZA ii. 195 (citing Neubauer, and As. tarpû, spectre), al. √ [[רפא]], cf. [[רְפָאִים]]);—alw. ´[[ת]]::—portable and sts. small Ge 31:19, Ge 31:34, Ge 31:35 (called [[אֱלֽהִים]] v:Ge 31:30, all E), but in size and shape like a man 1Sa 19:13, 1Sa 19:16; in household shrine (v. also l.c.) Ju Jdg 17:5 (+ [[אֵפוֹד]], cf. GFM:Ju), Jdg 18:14, Jdg 18:17 (both + [[אֵפוֹד]], [[פֶּסֶל]], [[מַסֵּכָה]]), cf. v:Jdg 18:20 (om. [[מַסֵּכָה]]), Ho 3:4 (+ ´[[א]]:, [[מַצֵּבָה]], [[וֶבַךְ]]); condemned 1Sa 15:23, 2Ki 23:24 (+ [[גִּלֻּלִים]]); used in divining (by king of Bab.), ´[[שָׁאַל בַּתּ]]: Ez Eze 21:26 (+ [[קִלְקַל בַּתִצִּים]], [[רָאָח בַּכָּבֵד]]); as giving empty oracles Zec 10:2 (‖[[הַקּוֹסְמִים ]]).—Vid.
